The broadcaster's user ID.

channel.follow@2.description: the specified channel receives a follow.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID for the channel you want to get follow notifications for.

channel.ad_break.begin@1.description: a midroll commercial break has started running.

duration_seconds.description: Length in seconds of the mid-roll ad break requested

set_id.description: An ID that identifies this set of chat badges.

bits.description: The amount of Bits the user cheered.

color.description: The color of the user's name in the chat room. This is a hexadecimal RGB color code in the form, #<RGB>. This tag may be empty if it is never set.

Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_broadcaster_user_name.description: The user name of the broadcaster of the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_broadcaster_user_login.description: The login of the broadcaster of the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_message_id.description: The UUID that identifies the source message from the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_badges.description: The list of chat badges for the chatter in the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

set_id.description: The ID that identifies this set of chat badges.

id.description: The ID that identifies this version of the badge. The ID can be any value.

info.description: Contains metadata related to the chat badges in the badges tag. Currently, this tag contains metadata only for subscriber badges, to indicate the number of months the user has been a subscriber.

is_source_only.description: Determines if a message delivered during a shared chat session is only sent to the source channel. Has no effect if the message is not sent during a shared chat session.

sub.description: Information about the sub event. Null if notice_type is not sub.

sub_tier.description:
The type of subscription plan being used. Possible values are:
- 1000 - First level of paid or Prime subscription.
- 2000 - Second level of paid subscription.
- 3000 - Third level of paid subscription.

is_prime.description: Indicates if the subscription was obtained through Amazon Prime.

duration_months.description: The number of months the subscription is for.

resub.description: Information about the resub event. Null if notice_type is not resub.

cumulative_months.description: The total number of months the user has subscribed.

duration_months.description: The number of months the subscription is for.

streak_months.description: The total number of months the user has subscribed.

sub_tier.description:
The type of subscription plan being used. Possible values are:
- 1000 - First level of paid or Prime subscription.
- 2000 - Second level of paid subscription.
- 3000 - Third level of paid subscription.

is_prime.description: The number of consecutive months the user has subscribed.

is_gift.description: Whether or not the resub was a result of a gift.

gifter_is_anonymous.description: Whether or not the gift was anonymous.

recipient_user_name.description: The user name of the subscription gift recipient.

The type of subscription plan being used. Possible values are:

- 2000 - Second level of paid subscription.
- 3000 - Third level of paid subscription.

sub_tier.description:

  • 1000 - First level of paid or Prime subscription.

  • 3000 - Third level of paid subscription.

cumulative_total.description: The amount of gifts the gifter has given in this channel. Null if anonymous.

prime_paid_upgrade.description: Information about the Prime gift paid upgrade event. Null if notice_type is not prime_paid_upgrade

sub_tier.description:
The type of subscription plan being used. Possible values are:
- 1000 - First level of paid or Prime subscription.
- 2000 - Second level of paid subscription.
- 3000 - Third level of paid subscription.

pay_it_forward.description: Information about the pay it forward event. Null if notice_type is not pay_it_forward

gifter_user_name.description: The user name of the user who gifted the subscription. Null if anonymous.

raid.description: Information about the raid event. Null if notice_type is not raid

user_name.description: The user name of the broadcaster raiding this channel.

viewer_count.description: The number of viewers raiding this channel from the broadcaster's channel.

profile_image_url.description: Profile image URL of the broadcaster raiding this channel.

unraid.description: Returns an empty payload if notice_type is not unraid, otherwise returns null.

announcement.description: Information about the announcement event. Null if notice_type is not {::nomarkdown} announcement

bits_badge_tier.description: Information about the Bits badge tier event. Null if notice_type is not bits_badge_tier

tier.description: The tier of the Bits badge the user just earned.

charity_donation.description: Information about the announcement event. Null if notice_type is not charity_donation

amount.description: An object that contains the amount of money that the user paid.

value.description: The monetary amount. The amount is specified in the currency's minor unit.

decimal_place.description: The number of decimal places used by the currency.

currency.description: The ISO-4217 three-letter currency code that identifies the type of currency in value.

source_broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID of the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message notification happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_broadcaster_user_name.description: The user name of the broadcaster of the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message notification happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_broadcaster_user_login.description: The login of the broadcaster of the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message notification happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_message_id.description: The UUID that identifies the source message from the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

source_badges.description: The list of chat badges for the chatter in the channel the message was sent from. Is null when the message happens in the same channel as the broadcaster. Is not null when in a shared chat session, and the action happens in the channel of a participant other than the broadcaster.

set_id.description: The ID that identifies this set of chat badges.

id.description: The ID that identifies this version of the badge. The ID can be any value.

info.description: Contains metadata related to the chat badges in the badges tag. Currently, this tag contains metadata only for subscriber badges, to indicate the number of months the user has been a subscriber.

channel.chat_settings.update@1.label: Channel Chat Settings Update
channel.chat_settings.update@1.description: the broadcaster's chat settings are updated.

broadcaster_user_id.description: User ID of the channel to receive chat settings update events for.

user_id.description: The user ID to read chat as.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The ID of the broadcaster specified in the request.

broadcaster_user_login.description: The login of the broadcaster specified in the request.

broadcaster_user_name.description: The user name of the broadcaster specified in the request.

emote_mode.description: A Boolean value that determines whether chat messages must contain only emotes. True if only messages that are 100% emotes are allowed; otherwise false.

follower_mode.description:
A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only, based on how long they've followed.

True if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to followers only; otherwise false.

See follower_mode_duration_minutes for how long the followers must have followed the broadcaster to participate in the chat room.

follower_mode_duration_minutes.description:
The length of time, in minutes, that the followers must have followed the broadcaster to participate in the chat room. See follower_mode.

Null if follower_mode is false.

slow_mode.description:
A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster limits how often users in the chat room are allowed to send messages.

Is true, if the broadcaster applies a delay; otherwise, false.

See slow_mode_wait_time_seconds for the delay.

slow_mode_wait_time_seconds.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, that users need to wait between sending messages. See slow_mode.

Null if slow_mode is false.

subscriber_mode.description:
A Boolean value that determines whether only users that subscribe to the broadcaster's channel can talk in the chat room.

True if the broadcaster restricts the chat room to subscribers only; otherwise false.

unique_chat_mode.description:
A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcaster requires users to post only unique messages in the chat room.

True if the broadcaster requires unique messages only; otherwise false.

channel.subscribe@1.label: Channel Subscribe
channel.subscribe@1.description: the specified channel receives a subscriber. This does not include resubscribes.

user_login.description: The user login for the user who subscribed to the specified channel.

user_name.description: The user display name for the user who subscribed to the specified channel.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The requested broadcaster ID.

tier.description: The tier of the subscription. Valid values are 1000, 2000, and 3000.

is_gift.description: Whether the subscription is a gift.

channel.subscription.end@1.label: Channel Subscription End
channel.subscription.end@1.description: a subscription to the specified channel ends.

is_gift.description: Whether the subscription was a gift.

channel.subscription.gift@1.label: Channel Subscription Gift

total.description: The number of subscriptions in the subscription gift.

tier.description: The tier of subscriptions in the subscription gift.

cumulative_total.description: The number of subscriptions gifted by this user in the channel. This value is null for anonymous gifts or if the gifter has opted out of sharing this information.

is_anonymous.description: Whether the subscription gift was anonymous.

text.description: The text of the resubscription chat message.

emotes.description: An array that includes the emote ID and start and end positions for where the emote appears in the text.

begin.description: The index of where the Emote starts in the text.

end.description: The index of where the Emote ends in the text.

cumulative_months.description: The total number of months the user has been subscribed to the channel.

streak_months.description: The number of consecutive months the user's current subscription has been active. This value is null if the user has opted out of sharing this information.

duration_months.description: The month duration of the subscription.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The requested broadcaster ID.

channel.raid@1.label: Channel Raid
channel.raid@1.description: the broadcaster raids another broadcaster's channel.

from_broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID that created the channel raid you want to get notifications for. Use this parameter if you want to know when a specific broadcaster raids another broadcaster. The channel raid condition must include either from_broadcaster_user_id or to_broadcaster_user_id.

to_broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID that received the channel raid you want to get notifications for. Use this parameter if you want to know when a specific broadcaster is raided by another broadcaster. The channel raid condition must include either from_broadcaster_user_id or to_broadcaster_user_id.

ends_at.description: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the timeout ends. Is null if the user was banned instead of put in a timeout.

is_permanent.description: Indicates whether the ban is permanent (true) or a timeout (false). If true, ends_at will be null.

channel.guest_star_guest.update@beta.label: Channel Guest Star Guest Update
channel.guest_star_guest.update@beta.description: a guest or a slot is updated in an active Guest Star session.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID of the channel hosting the Guest Star Session

moderator_user_id.description: The user ID of the moderator or broadcaster of the specified channel.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The non-host broadcaster user ID.

session_id.description: ID representing the unique session that was started.

moderator_user_id.description: The user ID of the moderator who updated the guest's state (could be the host). null if the update was performed by the guest.

moderator_user_name.description: The moderator display name. null if the update was performed by the guest.

moderator_user_login.description: The moderator login. null if the update was performed by the guest.

guest_user_id.description: The user ID of the guest who transitioned states in the session. null if the slot is now empty.

guest_user_name.description: The guest display name. null if the slot is now empty.

guest_user_login.description: The guest login. null if the slot is now empty.

slot_id.description: The ID of the slot assignment the guest is assigned to. null if the guest is in the INVITED, REMOVED, READY, or ACCEPTED state.

state.description:
The current state of the user after the update has taken place. null if the slot is now empty. Can otherwise be one of the following:
- invited  The guest has transitioned to the invite queue. This can take place when the guest was previously assigned a slot, but have been removed from the call and are sent back to the invite queue.
- accepted  The guest has accepted the invite and is currently in the process of setting up to join the session.
- ready  The guest has signaled they are ready and can be assigned a slot.
- backstage  The guest has been assigned a slot in the session, but is not currently seen live in the broadcasting software.
- live  The guest is now live in the host's broadcasting software.
- removed  The guest was removed from the call or queue.
- accepted  The guest has accepted the invite to the call.

host_user_id.description: User ID of the host channel.

host_video_enabled.description: Flag that signals whether the host is allowing the slot's video to be seen by participants within the session. null if the guest is not slotted.

host_audio_enabled.description: Flag that signals whether the host is allowing the slot's audio to be heard by participants within the session. null if the guest is not slotted.

host_volume.description: Value between 0-100 that represents the slot's audio level as heard by participants within the session. null if the guest is not slotted.

channel.guest_star_settings.update@beta.label: Channel Guest Star Settings Update
channel.guest_star_settings.update@beta.description: the host preferences for Guest Star have been updated.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID of the channel hosting the Guest Star Session

moderator_user_id.description: The user ID of the moderator or broadcaster of the specified channel.

broadcaster_user_id.description: User ID of the host channel.

is_moderator_send_live_enabled.description: Flag determining if Guest Star moderators have access to control whether a guest is live once assigned to a slot.

slot_count.description: Number of slots the Guest Star call interface will allow the host to add to a call.

is_browser_source_audio_enabled.description: Flag determining if browser sources subscribed to sessions on this channel should output audio.

group_layout.description:
This setting determines how the guests within a session should be laid out within a group browser source. Can be one of the following values:
- tiled  All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size.
- screenshare  All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size. If there is an active screen share, it is sized larger than the other guests.
- horizontal_top  Indicates the group layout will contain all participants in a top-aligned horizontal stack.
- horizontal_bottom  Indicates the group layout will contain all participants in a bottom-aligned horizontal stack.
- vertical_left  Indicates the group layout will contain all participants in a left-aligned vertical stack.
- vertical_right  Indicates the group layout will contain all participants in a right-aligned vertical stack.

broadcaster_user_id.description: User ID of the channel to receive chat message events for.
The ID of the channel where the treatment for a suspicious user was updated.

broadcaster_user_name.description: The display name of the channel where the treatment for a suspicious user was updated.

broadcaster_user_login.description: The login of the channel where the treatment for a suspicious user was updated.

user_id.description: The user ID of the user that sent the message.

user_name.description: The user name of the user that sent the message.

user_login.description: The user login of the user that sent the message.

low_trust_status.description: The status set for the suspicious user. Can be the following: "none", "active_monitoring", or "restricted"

shared_ban_channel_ids.description: A list of channel IDs where the suspicious user is also banned.

types.description: User types (if any) that apply to the suspicious user, can be "manually_added", "ban_evader", or "banned_in_shared_channel".

ban_evasion_evaluation.description: A ban evasion likelihood value (if any) that as been applied to the user automatically by Twitch, can be "unknown", "possible", or "likely".

message_id.description: The UUID that identifies the message.

text.description: The chat message in plain text.

fragments.description: Ordered list of chat message fragments.

type.description: The type of message fragment. Possible values: -text -cheermote -emote

text.description: Message text in fragment.

prefix.description: The name portion of the Cheermote string that you use in chat to cheer Bits. The full Cheermote string is the concatenation of {prefix} + {number of Bits}.

tier.description: The tier level of the cheermote.

id.description: An ID that uniquely identifies this emote.

emote_set_id.description: An ID that identifies the emote set that the emote belongs to.

channel.hype_train.begin@1.label: Hype Train Begin
channel.hype_train.begin@1.description: a Hype Train begins on the specified channel.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The ID of the broadcaster that you want to get Hype Train begin notifications for.
The requested broadcaster ID.

total.description: Total points contributed to the Hype Train.

progress.description: The number of points contributed to the Hype Train at the current level.

goal.description: The number of points required to reach the next level.

user_login.description: The user's login name.

user_name.description: The user's display name.

type.description:
The contribution method used. Possible values are:
- bits - Bits contributions with Cheering, Power-ups, and Extensions.
- subscription - Subscription activity like subscribing or gifting subscriptions.
- other - Covers other contribution methods not listed.

total.description: The total amount contributed. If type is bits, total represents the amount of Bits used. If type is subscription, total is 500, 1000, or 2500 to represent tier 1, 2, or 3 subscriptions, respectively.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that made the contribution.

user_login.description: The user's login name.

user_name.description: The user's display name.

expires_at.description: The time when the Hype Train expires. The expiration is extended when the Hype Train reaches a new level.

is_golden_kappa_train.description: Indicates if the Hype Train is a Golden Kappa Train.

value / 10^decimal_places

currency.description: The ISO-4217 three-letter currency code that identifies the type of currency in value.

channel.shoutout.create@1.label: Shoutout Create
channel.shoutout.create@1.description: the specified broadcaster sends a Shoutout.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The ID of the broadcaster that you want to receive notifications about when they send a Shoutout.

moderator_user_id.description: The ID of the broadcaster that gave the Shoutout or one of the broadcaster's moderators.

to_broadcaster_user_id.description: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that received the Shoutout.

moderator_user_id.description: An ID that identifies the moderator that sent the Shoutout. If the broadcaster sent the Shoutout, this ID is the same as the ID in broadcaster_user_id.

viewer_count.description: The number of users that were watching the broadcaster's stream at the time of the Shoutout.

started_at.description: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when the moderator sent the Shoutout.

cooldown_ends_at.description: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when the broadcaster may send a Shoutout to a different broadcaster.

target_cooldown_ends_at.description: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when the broadcaster may send another Shoutout to the broadcaster in to_broadcaster_user_id.

started_at.description: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when the moderator sent the Shoutout.

conduit.shard.disabled@1.label: Conduit Shard Disabled
conduit.shard.disabled@1.description: EventSub disables a shard due to the status of the underlying transport changing.

status.description: The new status of the transport.

session_id.description: WebSocket session ID. Null if method is set to webhook.

connected_at.description: Time that the WebSocket session connected. Null if method is set to webhook.

disconnected_at.description: Time that the WebSocket session disconnected. Null if method is set to webhook.

user_name.description: The transaction's user display name.

sku.description: Unique identifier for the product acquired.

in_development.description: Flag indicating if the product is in development. If in_development is true, bits will be 0.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The ID of the broadcaster to get notified about. The ID must match the user_id in the OAuth access token.

id.description: An ID that identifies this event.

broadcaster_user_id.description: An ID that uniquely identifies the broadcaster.

type.description:
The type of goal. Possible values are:
- follow  The goal is to increase followers.
- subscription  The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in tier points associated with the subscriptions.
- subscription_count  The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in the number of subscriptions.
- new_subscription  The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in tier points associated with the subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).
- new_subscription_count  The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in the number of subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).
- new_bit  The goal is to increase the amount of Bits used on the channel.
- new_cheerer  The goal is to increase the number of unique Cheerers to Cheer on the channel.

description.description: A description of the goal, if specified. The description may contain a maximum of 40 characters.

is_achieved.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the broadcaster achieved their goal. Is true if the goal was achieved; otherwise, false.

Only the channel.goal.end event includes this field.

current_amount.description:
The goal's current value.

The goal's type determines how this value is increased or decreased.
- If type is follow, this field is set to the broadcaster's current number of followers. This number increases with new followers and decreases when users unfollow the broadcaster.
- If type is subscription, this field is increased and decreased by the points value associated with the subscription tier.
- If type is subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription and decreased by 1 for each user that unsubscribes.
- If type is new_subscription, this field is increased by the points value associated with the subscription tier.
- If type is new_subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription.

started_at.description: The UTC timestamp in RFC 3339 format, which indicates when the broadcaster created the goal.

ended_at.description:
The UTC timestamp in RFC 3339 format, which indicates when the broadcaster ended the goal.

Only the channel.goal.end event includes this field.

channel.goal.progress@1.label: Goal Progress
channel.goal.progress@1.description: progress (either positive or negative) is made towards the broadcaster's goal.

stream.online@1.label: Stream Online
stream.online@1.description: the specified broadcaster starts a stream.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID you want to get stream online notifications for.
The broadcaster's user id.

type.description: The stream type. Valid values are: live, playlist, watch_party, premiere, rerun.

started_at.description: The timestamp at which the stream went online at.

stream.offline@1.label: Stream Offline
stream.offline@1.description: the specified broadcaster stops a stream.

broadcaster_user_id.description: The broadcaster user ID you want to get stream offline notifications for.
The broadcaster's user id.

user.authorization.grant@1.label: User Authorization Grant
user.authorization.grant@1.description: a user's authorization has been granted to your client id.

client_id.description: Your application's client id. The provided client_id must match the client id in the application access token.
The client_id of the application that was granted user access.

user_id.description: The user id for the user who has granted authorization for your client id.

user_login.description: The user login for the user who has granted authorization for your client id.

user_name.description: The user display name for the user who has granted authorization for your client id.

user.authorization.revoke@1.label: User Authorization Revoke
user.authorization.revoke@1.description: a user's authorization has been revoked for your client id.

client_id.description: Your application's client id. The provided client_id must match the client id in the application access token.
The client_id of the application with revoked user access.

user_id.description: The user id for the user who has revoked authorization for your client id.

user_login.description: The user login for the user who has revoked authorization for your client id. This is null if the user no longer exists.

user_name.description: The user display name for the user who has revoked authorization for your client id. This is null if the user no longer exists.

user.update@1.label: User Update
user.update@1.description: a user has updated their account.

user_id.description: The user ID for the user you want update notifications for.
The user's user id.

user_login.description: The user's user login.

user_name.description: The user's user display name.

email.description: The user's email address. The event includes the user's email address only if the app used to request this event type includes the user:read:email scope for the user; otherwise, the field is set to an empty string. See "Create EventSub Subscription".

email_verified.description:
A Boolean value that determines whether Twitch has verified the user's email address. Is true if Twitch has verified the email address; otherwise, false.

NOTE: Ignore this field if the email field contains an empty string.

user_id.description: The user_id of the person receiving whispers.

from_user_id.description: The ID of the user sending the message.

from_user_name.description: The name of the user sending the message.

from_user_login.description: The login of the user sending the message.

to_user_id.description: The ID of the user receiving the message.

to_user_name.description: The name of the user receiving the message.

to_user_login.description: The login of the user receiving the message.

text.description: The body of the whisper message.
